column2: Intelligent Access to Text: Integrating Information
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent font-largest page-top headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: Extraction Technology into Text Browsers

column2: ABSTRACT
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent font-largest column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: In this paper we show how two standard outputs from information
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: extraction (IE) systems – named entity annotations and scenario
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: templates – can be used to enhance access to text collections via
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a standard text browser. We describe how this information is used
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: in a prototype system designed to support information workers’ ac-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cess to a pharmaceutical news archive as part of their “industry
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: watch” function. We also report results of a preliminary, qualita-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tive user evaluation of the system, which while broadly positive in-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: dicates further work needs to be done on the interface to make users
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: aware of the increased potential of IE-enhanced text browsers.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1. INTRODUCTION
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space itemization above-line-space

column2: Information extraction (IE) technology, as promoted and defined
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: by the DARPA Message Understanding Conferences [4, 5] and
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: the current ACE component of TIDES [1], has resulted in impres-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sive new abilities to extract structured information from texts, and
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: complements more traditional information retrieval (IR) technol-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ogy which retrieves documents or passages of relevance from text
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: collections and leaves information seekers to browse the retrieved
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sub-collection (e.g. [2]). However, while IR technology has been
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: readily incorporated into end-user applications (e.g. web search
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: engines), IE technology has not yet been as successfully deployed
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: in end-user systems as its proponents had hoped. There are several
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: reasons for this, including:
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-colon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1. Porting cost. Moving IE systems to new domains requires
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: considerable expenditure of time and expertise, either to cre-
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ate/modify domain-specific resources and rule bases, or to
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: annotate texts for supervised machine learning approaches.
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2. Sensitivity to inaccuracies in extracted data. IE holds out
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space itemization

column2: the promise of being able to construct structured databases
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line headchar-lower

column2: from text sources automatically, but extraction results are by
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: no means perfect. Thus, the technology is only appropriate
column3: page=0 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent aligned-line headchar-lower above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space
page=0 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent font-smallest hanged-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: for applications where some error is tolerable and readily de-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tectable by end users.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3. Complexity of integration into end-user systems. IE sys-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space itemization tailchar-hiphen

column2: tems produce results (named entity tagged texts, filled tem-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: plates) which must be incorporated into larger, more sophis-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ticated application systems if end users are to gain benefit
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: from them.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In this paper we present the approach taken in the TRESTLE
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: project (Text Retrieval Extraction and Summarisation Technolo-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: gies for Large Enterprises) which addresses the second and third of
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: these problems; and also preliminary results from the user testing
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: evaluation of the TRESTLE interface. The goal of the TRESTLE
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: project is to develop an advanced text access facility to support
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: information workers at GlaxoSmithKline (GSK), a large pharma-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ceutical corporation. Specifically, the project aims to provide en-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: hanced access to Scrip <sup>1</sup> , the largest circulation pharmaceutical in-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified font-largest aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: dustry newsletter, in order to increase the effectiveness of employ-
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ees in their “industry watch” function, which involves both broad
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: current awareness and tracking of people, companies and products,
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: particularly the progress of new drugs through the clinical trial and
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: regulatory approval process.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2. IE AND INFORMATION SEEKING IN
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space itemization above-line-space

column2: LARGE ENTERPRISES
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent right-indent font-largest indented-line shorter-tail line-space headchar-capital above-line-space

column2: While TRESTLE aims to support information workers in the
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: pharmaceutical industry, most of the functionality it embodies is
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: required in any large enterprise. Our analysis of user requirements
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: at GlaxoSmithKline has led us to distinguish various categories
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of information seeking. At the highest level we must distinguish
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: requirements for current awareness from those for retrospective
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: search. Current awareness requirements can be further split into
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: general updating (what’s happened in the industry news today/this
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: week) and entity or event-based tracking (e.g. what’s happened
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: concerning a specific drug or what regulatory decisions have been
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: made).
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Retrospective search tends to break down into historical tracking
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: of entities or events of interest (e.g. where has a specific person
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: been reported before, what is the clinical trial history of a particular
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: drug) and search for a specific event or a remembered context in
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: which a specific entity played a role.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: <sup></sup> Scrip is the trademark of PJB Publications Ltd. See
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column centered left-indent font-largest longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-super

column2: http://www.pjbpub.co.uk.
column3: page=0 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent font-smallest shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: __Figure 1__
column3: page=1 xpos=-1 ypos=-6 single-column centered left-over right-over box page-top figure-area above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 1: TRESTLE Architecture
column3: page=1 xpos=3 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Notice that both types of information seeking require the identi-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column left-indent column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: fication of entities and events in the news – precisely the function-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ality that IE systems are intended to deliver.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3. THE TRESTLE SYSTEM
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line line-blank-line line-double-space line-space itemization above-line-space

column2: The overall archictecture of the TRESTLE system is shown in
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: Figure 1. The system comprises an on-line and an off-line com-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified hanged-line string-figure headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ponent. The off-line component runs automatically whenever a
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: new electronic delivery of Scrip takes place. It runs an IE System
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (the LaSIE system, developed for participation in the MUC evalu-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-hiphen

column2: ations [6]), which yields as output Named Entity (NE) tagged texts
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and Scenario Templates. To address the domain of interest, the
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: MUC-7 NE categories of person, location and organisation have
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: been retained and the categories of drug names and diseases have
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: been added. The system generates three scenario templates: person
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: tracking (a minor modification of the MUC-6 management succes-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: sion scenario), clinical trials experimental results (drug, phase of
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: trial, experimental parameters/outcomes) and regulatory announce-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ments (drugs approved, rejected by various agencies).
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: After the IE system outputs the NE tagged texts and scenario
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: templates, an indexing process is run to update indices which are
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: keyed by entity type (person, drug, disease, etc.) and date, and by
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: scenario type and date.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The on-line component of TRESTLE is a dynamic web page cre-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ation process which responds to the users’ information seeking be-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: haviour, expressed as clicks on hypertext links in a browser-based
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: interface, by generating web pages from the information held in
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the indexed IE results and the original Scrip texts. A basic Infor-
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mation Retrieval component has also been plugged in to TRESTLE
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to provide users with seamless access to query Scrip texts, i.e., not
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: confined to the pre-defined named entities in the index.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.1 Interface Overview
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-line-space

column2: The interface allows four ways of accessing Scrip: by headline,
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: by named entity category, by scenario summary, and by freetext
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: search. For the three first access routes the date range of Scrip
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: articles accessible may be set to the current day, previous day, last
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: week, last four weeks or full archive.
column3: page=1 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period column-bottom

column2: The interface is a browser whose main window is divided into
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column left-indent column-top headchar-capital

column2: three independently scrollable frames (see Figure 2). An additional
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: frame (the “head frame”) is located at the top displaying the date
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: range options, as well as information about where the user cur-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: rently is in the system. Down the full length of the left side of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the window is the “access frame”, in which text access options are
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: specified. The remainder of the main window is split horizonally
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: into two frames, the upper of which is used to display the auto-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: matically generated index information (the “index frame”) and the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: lower of which is used to present the Scrip articles themselves (the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: “text frame”).
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail tailchar-period

column2: Headline access is the traditional way GSK Scrip users access
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: text, and is retained as the initial default presentation in TRESTLE.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: In the index frame a list of Scrip headlines is presented in reverse
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: chronological order. Each headline is a clickable link to full text of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the article; clicking on one displays the full text in the text frame
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: (like Figure 2, only without the second column in the index frame).
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line tailchar-period

column2: Named entity and scenario access are the novel IE-based tech-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent indented-line headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: niques TRESTLE supports.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent hanged-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.2 NEAT: Named Entity Access to Text
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-line-space

column2: From the access frame a user selects a category, for example,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: drugs. The index frame then displays an alphabetically ordered list
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: of drug names extracted from the Scrip texts by the IE engine (Fig-
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ure 2). To the right of each drug name is the title of the article from
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: which the name was extracted (if a name occurs in multiple texts,
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: there are multiple lines in the index frame). Once again the title is
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a hyperlink to the text and if followed the full text is displayed in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: the text frame.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: When a text is displayed in the text frame, every occurrence of
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: every name which has been identified as a named entity of any
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: category is displayed as a clickable link; furthermore, each name
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: category is displayed in a different colour. Clicking on a name, say
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: a company name (e.g. Warner-Lambert in Figure 2) occurring in
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: a text which was accessed initially via the drug index, updates the
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: index frame with the subset of entries from the index for that name
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: only – in our example, all entries for the selected company.
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: In addition to listing the full drug index alphabetically, the user
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: may also enter a specific drug name in the Index Look-up box
column3: page=1 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower page-bottom

column2: __Figure 2__
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=-9 single-column left-indent right-over box page-top figure-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 2: TRESTLE Interface: NEAT
column3: page=2 xpos=3 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: in the access frame, and the index frame will then list the titles of
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: all articles containing that drug name.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: NEAT allows rapid text navigation by named entity. A user with
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: a watching brief on, say diabetes, can start by reviewing recent ar-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified hanged-line itemization headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ticles mentioning diabetes, but then follow up all recent references
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: to companies or drugs mentioned in these articles, extending the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: search back in time as necessary, and at any point branching off to
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: pursue related entities.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3.3 SCAT: Scenario Access to Text
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-line-space

column2: While NEAT allows navigation by named entity, the user still
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: derives information by reading the original Scrip texts. Scenario
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: access to text (SCAT) utilises summaries generated from templates
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: extracted by the scenario template filling component of the IE sys-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tem to provide access to the source texts. It is based on the obser-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: vation that many scenarios of interest can be expressed via single
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: sentence summaries. For example, regulatory announcements in
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the pharmaceutical industry can be captured in a template and sum-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: marised via one or more simple sentence schemas such as “Agency
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: approves/rejects/considers Company’s Drug for Disease in Juris-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: diction”.
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: To use SCAT a user selects one of the tracking options (keep-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing track) from the access frame of the interface. A list of one
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: line summaries, one per extracted scenario, is then presented in
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the index frame. Along with each summary is a link to the source
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: text, which allows the user to confirm the correctness of the sum-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: mary, or to follow up for more detail/context. Clicking on this link
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: causes the source text to appear in the text frame (see Figure 3).
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The presence of a summary in a Scrip article is also presented to
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: the user through coloured tracking flags next to the article head-
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: line (see Figure 2). This feature can be viewed as a shortcut to the
column3: page=2 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower column-bottom

column2: summary facility; clicking the flag gives the generated summary in
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: the text frame together with the link to the source. Of course suffi-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cient information may have been gleaned from the summary alone,
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: obviating the need to read the full text.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4. PRELIMINARY USER EVALUATION
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space itemization above-line-space

column2: Although input from users has informed each stage of the de-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: sign process from the conceptual non-interactive mock-ups to the
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: development of the web-based prototype, this section reports on a
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: preliminary evaluation of user testing of the first fully functional
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: prototype. The aim was to elicit feedback on the presentation and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: usability of NEAT and SCAT and the overall interface design. The
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: objectives were two-fold. Firstly, and more broadly, to assess to
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: what extent the interface conformed to principles of good usability
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: design such as simplicity, consistency, predictability, and flexibil-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ity [7]. Secondly, and more importantly, to focus on the interaction
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: issues presented by NEAT and SCAT:
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-colon above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: procedurally, in terms of users’ ability to move between dif-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ferent search options in a logical and seamless fashion; and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower above-double-space above-line-space

column2: conceptually, in terms of users’ awareness and understanding
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column left-indent aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: of the respective functions for exploiting current and retro-
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column left-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: spective Scrip headlines and full text.
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4.1 Evaluation Methodology
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column right-indent font-largest hanged-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-line-space

column2: A group of eight users consisting of postgraduate students and
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: research staff were recruited from the Department of Information
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: Studies at the University of Sheffield. The subjects had different
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: subject backgrounds and all had experience of using web based
column3: page=2 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower page-bottom

column2: __Figure 3__
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=-10 single-column centered left-indent right-indent box page-top figure-area above-double-space above-line-space

column2: Figure 3: TRESTLE Interface: SCAT
column3: page=3 xpos=3 ypos=0 single-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space string-figure headchar-capital column-bottom above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: interfaces, searching for information online and some knowledge
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified column-top line-blank-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower

column2: of alerting/current awareness bulletins.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The focus of the exercise was to observe user-system interactions
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: ‘real time’ to gain insight into:
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column right-indent hanged-line shorter-tail tailchar-colon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: ease of use and learnability of the system;
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-semicolon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: preferred strategies for accessing text;
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-semicolon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: problems in interpreting the interface.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line line-double-space line-space headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: In addition, user perceptions of the interface were also elicited to
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: provide further explanations on searcher behaviour. A combination
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: of instruments was thus used including a usability questionnaire,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: verbal protocols and observational notes. Note that this evaluation
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: was a purely quantitative exercise aimed at gaining an understand-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ing of how the users responded to the novel functions offerred by
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the interface. A further evaluation will take place in an operational
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: setting with real end users from GSK.
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: After a brief introduction to the purpose of the evaluation and
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: a brief overview of the system, users were asked to explore the
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified hanged-line itemization headchar-lower

column2: system in an undirected manner, asking questions and providing
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: comments as they proceeded. Following this, they were asked to
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: carry out a number of tasks from a set of tasks that simulated typical
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: information needs characteristic of real end-users at GSK and were
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: instructed to identify a ‘relevant’ article for each task. The tasks
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: were designed to exploit the full functionality of the prototype; an
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: example of the task is given below:
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-colon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: You’ve heard that one of your colleagues, Mr Garcia,
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column centered left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: has recently accepted an appointment at another phar-
column3: page=3 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen column-bottom

column2: maceutical company. You want to find out which com-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column centered left-indent right-indent column-top headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: pany he will be moving to and what post he has taken
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column centered left-indent right-indent aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: up.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The number of tasks completed by each subject varied according
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column left-indent hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: to the subject’s thoroughness in exploring the system. The order in
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: which the tasks were assigned was random.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4.2 Access Strategies
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=2 right-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space numbered-heading2 above-line-space

column2: Access to named entities was made available in three ways:
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent right-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital tailchar-colon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 1. by clicking directly on a list of four categories;
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=3 right-column left-indent right-indent shorter-tail line-double-space line-space itemization tailchar-semicolon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 2. through the index look up query box;
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space itemization tailchar-semicolon above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 3. through the free-text keyword search option.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=4 right-column left-indent right-indent aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space itemization tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: The optimal strategy differed for the different assigned tasks. Most
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified hanged-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space headchar-capital

column2: subjects tended to use the index look-up as a first attempt irrespec-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tive of its appropriateness for the task in hand. Preference for the
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=5 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: use of the index look-up as opposed to selecting more general entity
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: categories may be explained by the fact that users knew what they
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: were looking for (i.e. an artefact of the assigned task). Moreover
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=6 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the query box for the index look-up option may have been a more
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: familiar feature which encouraged searchers to adopt a searching
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: strategy as opposed to browsing named entities. The preference for
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: using the index look-up option over free text searching may have
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=7 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: been influenced by the order of presentation as well as the promi-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: nence of the text entry box in the access frame. In addition for
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: assigned tasks where the choice was between any of the three en-
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=8 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tity access strategies, or using the tracking options, the majority of
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: users opted for the entity access via the index look-up. The novelty
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: of the tracking options appeared to be a contributory factor.
column3: page=3 xpos=5 ypos=9 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period page-bottom

column2: 4.3 User Perceptions
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent font-largest page-top numbered-heading2 above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4.3.0.1 Colour Coding.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line line-blank-line line-double-space line-space tailchar-period

column2: The colour coding of the named entities was highly noticeable,
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-comma

column2: although there was some disagreement on its usefulness. Of those
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: subjects that found the colour coding unhelpful, it was the choice of
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=0 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: colours that they objected to rather than the function of the colour
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: per se. Although subjects claimed that coloured entity links were
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: distracting when reading full news items, the majority indicated
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: that the linking to previous Scrip items was very useful. The dis-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: traction often had a positive effect in leading to useful and re-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lated articles. The overall integration of the current awareness and
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: retrospective searching functions through named entities was thus
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=1 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: widely appreciated.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4.3.0.2 Index Look-up.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-double-space line-space tailchar-period

column2: All subjects except one found the index look-up function use-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: ful, once they discovered that it was a quick way of accessing pre-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: defined named entity categories. The fact that the approach only
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=2 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: provided exact string matching was judged to be limiting.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 4.3.0.3 Scenario Tracking.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line shorter-tail line-double-space line-space tailchar-period

column2: The keeping track option was not as easily understood as
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: the named entity options. The label “keeping track” was misinter-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: preted by some subjects as a search history function or an alerting
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=3 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: service based on user profiles. After having used the tracking fa-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cility half of the subjects did, however, correctly understand the
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: function. One problem that arose was the differentiation between
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: summaries presented in SCAT and the actual Scrip headlines. Al-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: though the header informed searchers that they were viewing Scrip
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: summaries, the display of the summaries in the same frame where
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=4 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: the headlines were normally presented as well as the similarity in
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: content led to confusion.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: The coloured flags next to the headlines, which were meant to
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital

column2: serve as a tracking label to allow users to move seamlessly from
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: headlines to scenario summaries, raised another problem. Not only
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: was the meaning of the flag symbol poorly understood, but also
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: subjects did not realise that they could click on it. Moreover when
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=5 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: they clicked on the flag they expected to see a full news item rather
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: than a summary. Hence, the scenario access was both procedurally
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and conceptually confusing.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-blank-line above-double-space above-line-space

column2: 5. CONCLUSIONS
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=6 left-column right-indent font-largest aligned-line longer-tail line-blank-line line-double-space line-space itemization above-line-space

column2: To date IE has largely been a “technology push” activity, with
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail line-space headchar-capital

column2: language engineers working to develop core technologies. For the
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower

column2: technology to become usable, and for its further development to be
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: influenced by end user requirements (“user pull”), prototype end-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: user application systems must be built which exploit the signifi-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: cant achievement of the technology to date, while acknowledging
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: its limitations. In this paper we have described such a prototype,
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=7 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-comma

column2: the TRESTLE system, which exploits named entity and scenario
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: template IE technology to offer users novel ways to access textual
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: information.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Our preliminary evaluation has revealed that although search op-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column left-indent indented-line longer-tail headchar-capital tailchar-hiphen

column2: tions initially selected from the access frame were not always op-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified hanged-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: timal for undertaking set tasks, the colour coded textual and iconic
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=8 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: cues embedded in the headline index and full text frames on the
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: whole enabled users to exploit the different functions seamlessly.
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-period

column2: Whilst the TRESTLE interface appeared to support interaction at a
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-capital

column2: procedural level, at the conceptual level however, searchers did not
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: necessarily gain sufficient understanding of the underlying func-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: tionality, particularly in respect to the scenario access. For exam-
column3: page=4 xpos=0 ypos=9 left-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen column-bottom

column2: ple the inability to distinguish between the original headlines and
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified column-top headchar-lower

column2: the system generated summaries for SCAT was problematic and
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: requires further investigation. Other studies have reported simi-
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: lar issues in introducing more complex interactive search functions
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: [3, 8]. More meaningful labelling may in part address some of the
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line

column2: difficulties encountered. A more extensive evaluation in a work set-
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower tailchar-hiphen

column2: ting will follow to assess to what extent the integration of new and
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=0 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: established conventions can support users with domain knowledge
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and greater familiarity with alerting systems to adopt new searching
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column full-justified aligned-line headchar-lower

column2: and awareness approaches effectively.
column3: page=4 xpos=5 ypos=1 right-column right-indent aligned-line shorter-tail headchar-lower tailchar-period above-double-space above-line-space
